register.description: This register contains the IP revision code.

bitfield.description: IP revision [[br]][7:4] Major revision [[br]][3:0] Minor revision

register.description: This register allows the control of various parameters of the interconnect interface

bitfield.description: Master interface power management, standby/waitcontrol

bitenum.description: MStandby is asserted based on the internal activity of the module
MStandby is asserted only when the module is disabled

bitfield.description: Clock activity during wakeup mode period

bitenum.description: Interface and functional clocks are maintained during wakeup period
Interface clocks can be switched off and functional clocks are maintained during wakeup period
Functional clocks can be switched off and interface clocks are maintained during wakeup period
interface and functional clocks can be switched off.

bitfield.description: Slave interface power management, idle req/ack control

bitenum.description: Idle request is acknowledged based on the internal activity of the module
An idle request is never acknowledged
An idle request is acknowledged unconditionally

bitfield.description: Wakeup feature control
Software reset. [[br]]Set this bit to 1 to trigger a module reset. [[br]]The bit is automatically reset by the hardware. [[br]]During reads, it always returns
Internal interface clock gating strategy

bitenum.description: Automatic L3 and L4 interface clock gating strategy is applied based on interface activity

register.description: This register provides status information about the module, excluding interrupt status information.

bitfield.description: Internal reset monitoring

register.description: This register regroups all the status of module internal events that generate an interrupt. A write of 1 to a given bit resets the bit

bitfield.description: Wakeup
SyncLostDigital
SyncLost
Vid2EndWindow
Vid2FIFOUnderflow
Vid1EndWindow
Vid1FIFOUnderflow
OCPError
PaletteGammaLoading
GfxEndWindow
GfxFIFOUnderflow
ProgrammedLineNumber
ACBiasCountStatus
EVSYNC_ODD
EVSYNC_EVEN
VSYNC
FrameDone

register.description: This register allows the masking/unmasking of module internal interrupt sources, on an event-by-event basis.

bitfield.description: Wakeup mask
SyncLostDigital

bitenum.description: SyncLostDigital generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: SyncLost
Vid2EndWindow

bitenum.description: Vid2EndWindow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: Vid2FIFOUnderflow

bitenum.description: Vid2FIFOUnderflow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: EndVid1Window
Vid1FIFOUnderflow

bitenum.description: Vid1FIFOUnderflow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: OCPError

bitenum.description: OCPError generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: PaletteGammaMask

bitenum.description: PaletteGammaMask generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: GfxEndWindow

bitenum.description: GfxEndWindow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: GfxFIFOUnderflow

bitenum.description: GfxFIFOUnderflow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: ProgrammedLineNumber

bitenum.description: ProgrammedLineNumber generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: ACBiasCountStatus

bitenum.description: ACBiasCountStatus generates an interrupt when it occurs.

bitfield.description: EVSYNC_ODD

bitenum.description: EVSYNC_ODD generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: EVSYNC_EVEN

bitenum.description: EVSYNC_EVEN generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: VSYNC

bitenum.description: VSYNC generates an interrupt when it occurs.

bitfield.description: FrameMask

bitenum.description: FrameMask generates an interrupt when it occurs

register.description: The control register configures the display controller module

bitfield.description: Spatial/Temporal dithering number of frames

bitenum.description: Spatial and temporal over four frames
Spatial and temporal over two frames

bitfield.description: LCD Enable Signal Polarity
LCD Enable Signal: LCD interface active/inactive
Pixel clock free-running enabled/disabled
State of unused bits (TDM mode only)
Cycle format (TDM mode only)
Output Interface width (TDM mode only)
Enable the multiple cycle format (TDM mode used only for Active Matrix mode with the RFBI enable bit off).
Hold Time for digital output WR: EVSYNC Encoded value (from 0 to 7) holds time for digital output. [[br]]The data will be held for (HT + 1) external digital clock periods.
General Purpose Output Signal
General Purpose Output Signal
General Purpose Input Signal
General Purpose Input Signal
Overlay Optimization (available when graphics format is NOT is 1, 2, and [[br]]4-BPP)

bitenum.description: Graphics data below video1 window not fetched from memory.
Graphics data below video1 window fetched from memory or no overlap between graphics and video1 windows

bitfield.description: Stall mode for the LCD output

bitenum.description: Stall mode selected. The Display Controller sends the data without considering the VSYNC/HSYNC. The LCD output is disabled at the end of the transfer of the frame. The S/W has to re-enable the LCD output to generate a new frame. The stall mode is used in RFBI command modes

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the LCD interface

bitenum.description: 24-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
18-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
16-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface
12-bit output aligned on the LSB of the pixel data interface

bitfield.description: Spatial temporal dithering enable
Digital GO Command

bitenum.description: Users have finished programming the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the digital output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the external VSYNC
The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the digital output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed

bitfield.description: LCD GO Command

bitenum.description: Users have finished programming the shadow registers of the pipeline(s) associated with the LCD output and the hardware can update the internal registers at the VFP start period.
The hardware has finished updating the internal shadow registers of the pipeline(s) connected to the LCD output using the user values. The hardware resets the bit when the update is completed

bitfield.description: Mono [[br]]8-bit mode

bitenum.description: Pixel data [7:0] is used to output eight pixel values to the panel each pixel clock transition (only in Passive Mono 8-bit mode)
Pixel data [3:0] is used to output four pixel values to the panel at each pixel clock transition (only in Passive Mono 8-bit mode)

bitfield.description: LCD display type

bitenum.description: Active Matrix display operation enabled. Passive Matrix Dither logic and output FIFO bypassed
Passive or Passive Matrix display operation enabled. Passive Matrix dither logic enabled

bitfield.description: Monochrome/Color

bitenum.description: Monochrome operation enabled (Passive Matrix mode only)
Color operation enabled (Passive Matrix mode only)

bitfield.description: Digital enable

bitenum.description: Digital output disabled (at the end of the current field if interlace output when the bit is reset)

bitfield.description: LCD enable

bitenum.description: LCD output disabled (at the end of the frame when the bit is reset)
LCD output disabled (at the end of the frame when the bit is reset)

register.description: This control register configures the display controller module. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Selects the alpha blender (TV output)
Selects the alpha blender (LCD output)
Controls if the FIFO are refilled only when the LOW threshold is reached or if all FIFO are refilled when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold.

bitenum.description: All FIFOs are refilled up to high threshold when at least one of them reaches the LOW threshold. (only active FIFOs should be considered and when reaching the end of the frame the FIFO goes to empty condition so no need to fill it again)
Each FIFO is refilled when it reaches LOW threshold

bitfield.description: Controls the handshake between FIFO and RFBI STALL to prevent from underflow. [[br]]The bit should be set to 0 when the module is not in STALL mode

bitenum.description: The STALL signal from RFBI is used in combination with the FIFO fullness information to provide data to the RFBI module only when it does not generated FIFO underflow.
Only the STALL signal from RFBI is used regardless of the FIFO fullness information to provide data to the RFBI module

bitfield.description: Color phase rotation control wr: VFP
FIFO merge control

bitenum.description: FIFO merge enabled All the FIFOS are merged into a single one to be used by the single active pipeline
FIFO merge disabled Each FIFO is dedicated to one pipeline

bitfield.description: Transparency color key selection (digital output)

bitenum.description: Video source transparency color key selected in normal mode
Graphics destination transparency color key selected in normal mode or graphics source transparency color key selected in alpha mode

bitfield.description: Transparency color key enabled (digital output)

bitenum.description: Enable the transparency color key for digital output
Disable the transparency color key for digital output

bitfield.description: Transparency color key selection (LCD output)

bitenum.description: Video source transparency color key selected in normal mode
Graphics destination transparency color key selected in normal mode or graphics source transparency color key selected in alpha mode

bitfield.description: Transparency color key enabled (LCD output)

bitenum.description: Enable the transparency color key for the LCD
Disable the transparency color key for the LCD

bitfield.description: Functional clocks gated enabled
ACBias Gated Enabled
VSYNC Gated Enabled
HSYNC Gated Enabled
Pixel Clock Gated Enabled
Pixel Data Gated Enabled
Palette/Gamma Table selection

bitenum.description: LUT used as gamma table (only if graphics format is NOT BITMAP1, 2, 4, and 8 or no graphics window present)
LUT used as palette (only if graphics format is BITMAP1, 2, 4, and 8)

bitfield.description: Loading Mode for the Palette/Gamma Table

bitenum.description: Palette/Gamma Table and frame data loaded on first frame then switch to 10 (H/W)
Frame data only loaded every frame
Palette/Gamma Table to be loaded. Users set the bit when the palette/gamma table has to be loaded. H/W resets the bit when table has been loaded. (DISPC_GFX_ATTRIBUTES. GfxEnable has to be set to 1)
Palette/Gamma Table and data are loaded every frame

bitfield.description: Pixel Gated Enable (only for Active Matrix Display)

bitenum.description: Pixel clock only toggles when there is valid data to display. (only in Active Matrix mode)
Pixel Gated Enable (only for Active Matrix Display)

register.description: The control register indicates the current LCD panel display line number

bitfield.description: Current LCD panel line number Current display line number. [[br]]The first active line has the value 0. [[br]]During blanking lines the line number is not incremented

register.description: The control register indicates the LCD panel display line number for the interrupt and the DMA request. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: LCD panel line number programming LCD line number defines the line on which the programmable interrupt is generated and the DMA request occurs

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the HSYNC signal. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Horizontal Back Porch. [[br]]Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the beginning of a line transmission before the first set of pixels is output to the display (program to value minus 1)

Horizontal front porch. [[br]]Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to add to the end of a line transmission before line clock is asserted (program to value minus 1)
Horizontal synchronization pulse width Encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of pixel clock periods to pulse the line clock at the end of each line (program to value minus 1).

register.description: The register configures the timing logic for the VSYNC signal. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Vertical back porch Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the beginning of a frame before the first set of pixels is output to the display
Vertical front porch Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the number of line clock periods to add to the end of each frame

Vertical synchronization pulse width In active mode, encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of line clock periods (program to value minus one) to pulse the frame clock (VSYNC) pin at the end of each frame after the end of frame wait (VFP) period elapses. [[br]]Frame clock uses as VSYNC signal in active mode. [[br]]In passive mode, encoded value (from 1 to 256) to specify the number of extra line clock periods (program to value minus one) to insert after the vertical front porch (VFP) period has elapsed.

register.description: The register configures the signal configuration. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: HSYNC/VSYNC Pixel clock Control On/Off

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven according to bit 16
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on opposite edges of pixel clock than pixel data

bitfield.description: Program HSYNC/VSYNC Rise or Fall

bitenum.description: HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on the rising edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1)
HSYNC and VSYNC are driven on falling edge of pixel clock (if bit 17 set to 1)

bitfield.description: Invert output enable

bitenum.description: Ac-bias is active low (active display mode)
Ac-bias is active high (active display mode)

bitfield.description: Invert pixel clock

bitenum.description: Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the falling-edge of the pixel clock
Data is driven on the LCD data lines on the rising-edge of the pixel clock

bitfield.description: Invert HSYNC

bitenum.description: Line clock pin is active low and inactive high
Line clock pin is active high and inactive low

bitfield.description: Invert VSYNC

bitenum.description: Frame clock pin is active low and inactive high
Frame clock pin is active high and inactive low

bitfield.description: AC-bias pin transitions per interrupt Value (from 0 to 15) used to specify the number of AC Bias pin transitions

AC-bias pin frequency Value (from 0 to 255) used to specify the number of line clocks to count before transitioning the ac-bias pin. [[br]]This pin is used to periodically invert the polarity of the power supply to prevent DC charge build-up within the display.

register.description: The register configures the divisors. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Display Controller Logic Clock Divisor Value (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the display controller logic clock based on the function clock. [[br]]The value 0 is invalid.
Pixel Clock Divisor Value (from 1 to 255) to specify the frequency of the pixel clock based on the Logic clock which is the functional clock divided by LCD. [[br]]The values 0 and 1 are invalid.

register.description: The register defines the global alpha value for the graphics and video 2 pipelines. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC for each bit field depending on the association of the each pipeline with the LCD or TV output.

bitfield.description: Global alpha value from 0 to 255. [[br]]0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque
Global alpha value from 0 to 255. [[br]]0 corresponds to fully transparent and 255 to fully opaque

register.description: The register configures the size of the digital output field (interlace), frame (progressive) (horizontal and vertical). Shadow register, updated on EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Lines per panel Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus one)
Pixels per line Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels contained within each line on the display (program to value minus one)

register.description: The register configures the panel size (horizontal and vertical). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: Lines per panel Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines per panel (program to value minus one)

Pixels per line Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels contains within each line on the display (program to value minus one). [[br]]When running in normal mode (stall mode is bypassed by setting DSS.DISPC_CONTROL[11] STALLMODE =0) the line width must be set to a value multiple of 8 pixels (ex: PPL=0x7)

register.description: The register configures the position of the graphics window. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Y position of the graphics window. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of the graphics window on the screen. [[br]]The line at the top has the Y-position 0.

X position of the graphics window. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of the graphics window on the screen. [[br]]The first pixel on the left of the screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the size of the graphics window. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the graphics window. [[br]]Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines of the graphics window (program to value minus one)
Number of pixels of the graphics window. [[br]]Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels per line of the graphics window (program to value minus one)

register.description: The register configures the graphics attributes. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: The field configures the DISPC GFX to process incoming data as pre-multiplied alpha data or non premultiplied alpha data. [[br]]Default setting is non pre-multiplied alpha data
Enables the self refresh of the graphics window from its own FIFO only

bitenum.description: The graphics pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the graphics FIFO is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the FIFO
The graphics pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the graphics pipeline. [[br]]The graphics pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. [[br]]The arbitration wheel gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. [[br]]When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them

bitenum.description: The graphics pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline
The graphics pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline

bitfield.description: Graphics rotation flag (used only in case of RGB24 packed format)
Graphics preload value

bitenum.description: H/W prefetches pixels up to high threshold value
H/W prefetches pixels up to the preload value defined in the preload register.

bitfield.description: Graphics endianness
Graphics Nibble Mode (only for 1, 2 and 4 BPP)
Graphics Channel Out configuration
Graphics DMA Burst Size
GfxReplicationEnable
Graphics format[[br]] Other enums: Reserved (0x7, 0xA, 0xB and 0xF)

bitenum.description: RGBx 32 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)

bitfield.description: GfxEnable

bitenum.description: Graphics enabled (graphics pipeline active and graphics window present on the screen)
Graphics disabled (graphics pipeline inactive and graphics window not present)

register.description: The register configures the graphics FIFO. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Graphics FIFO High Threshold Number of bytes defining the threshold value.
Graphics FIFO Low Threshold Number of bytes defining the threshold value

register.description: This register defines the graphics FIFO size.

bitfield.description: Graphics FIFO Size Number of bytes defining the FIFO value.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from (-2^31)-1 to 2^31) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the graphics buffer. [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]The value 1 means next pixel. [[br]]The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. [[br]]The value 1- (n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment between two pixels Encoded signed value (from (-2^15)-1 to 2^15) to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the graphics buffer. [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]The value 1 means next pixel. [[br]]The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. [[br]]The value [[br]]1-(n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to skip during video window display. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to skip during video window #1. [[br]]Encoded signed value (from (-2^31)-1 to 2^31) to specify the number of bytes to skip in the graphics buffer when video window #1 is displayed on top of the graphics and no transparency color is enabled.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the palette buffer or the gamma table buffer. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Base address of the palette/gamma table buffer (24-bit entries in 32- bit containers, aligned on 32-bit boundary).

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for video window #n(#j for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity: 0 for even field and 1 for odd field). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary)

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for video window #n(#j for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity: 0 for even field and 1 for odd field). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary)

register.description: The register configures the position of video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Y position of video window #n Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of video window #n. [[br]]The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
X position of video window #n Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of video window #n. [[br]]The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the size of video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of lines of video #n Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines of video window #n (program to value minus one).
Number of pixels of video window #n Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of video window #n (program to value minus one).
The field configures the DISPC VID2 to process incoming data as pre-multiplied alpha data or non pre-multiplied alpha data. [[br]]Default setting is non pre-multiplied alpha data.
Enables the self refresh of the video window from its own FIFO only.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the video FIFO is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the FIFO
The video pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the video pipeline. [[br]]The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. [[br]]The arbitration wheel gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. [[br]]When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline
The video pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline

bitfield.description: Video vertical line buffer split

bitenum.description: Vertical line buffers are split into two
Vertical line buffers are not split

bitfield.description: Video vertical resize tap number

bitenum.description: Five taps are used for the vertical filtering logic
Three taps are used for the vertical filtering logic. The other two taps are not used

bitfield.description: Video optimization in case of

bitenum.description: The DMA engine fetches two pixels for each 32-bit OCP request (RGB16 and YUV422) while doing 90- and 270-degree rotation (accessing on-chip memory and off-chip memory). The bit field [21] VIDVERTICALTAPS shall be set to 0x1, bit field [22] VIDLINEBUFFERSPLIT to 0x1, and all scaler registers shall be configured even for 1:1 ratio. Even width is required for the input picture when 5 taps are used.
The DMA engine fetches one pixel for each 32-bit OCP request (RGB16 and YUV422) while doing 90- and 270-degree rotation (accessing on-chip memory and off-chip memory).

bitfield.description: Video preload value

bitenum.description: H/W prefetches pixels up to the high threshold value.
H/W prefetches pixels up to the preload value defined in the preload register

bitfield.description: Video Row Repeat (YUV case only when rotating 90 or [[br]]270-degree)

bitenum.description: The Row data are fetched twice to extract both the Y components
Row of VIDn won't be read twice

bitfield.description: Video Endianness
Video Channel Out configuration
Video DMA Burst Size
Video Rotation Flag

bitenum.description: No rotation or VidFormat is RGB

bitfield.description: VidFullRange

bitenum.description: Full range selected: Y is not modified before the color space conversion
Limited range selected: 16 subtracted from Y before color space conversion

bitfield.description: VidReplicationEnable
VidColorConvEnable

bitenum.description: Enable Color Space Conversion CbYCr to RGB
Disable Color Space Conversion CbYCr to RGB

bitfield.description: Video Vertical Resize Configuration
Video Horizontal Resize Configuration
Video Resize Enable

bitenum.description: Enable both horizontal and vertical resize processing

bitfield.description: Video2 channel Format[[br]] Other enums: Reserved (all other values: 0x0 and 0x3, 0x7, and 0xF)

bitenum.description: RGBx 32 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)

bitfield.description: VidEnable

bitenum.description: Video enabled (video pipeline active and window present on the screen)
Video disabled (video pipeline inactive and window not present)

register.description: The register configures the video FIFO associated with video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video FIFO high threshold Number of bytes defining the threshold value
Video FIFO low threshold Number of bytes defining the threshold value

register.description: The register defines the video FIFO size for video pipeline #n.

bitfield.description: Video FIFO Size Number of bytes defining the FIFO value

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the buffer associated with video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from (-2^31)-1 to 2^31) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]The value 1 means next pixel. [[br]]The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. [[br]]The value 1- (n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels for the buffer associated with video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from (-2^15)-1 to 2^15) to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the video buffer. [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]The value 1 means next pixel. [[br]]The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. [[br]]The value [[br]]1-(n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up-/down-sampling of video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Vertical increment of the up-/down-sampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]Values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Horizontal increment of the up-/down-sampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]Values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the size of the video picture associated with video layer #nbefore up-/down-scaling. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines of the video picture in memory (program to value minus one)

Number of pixels of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the video picture in memory (program to value minus one). [[br]]The size is limited to the size of the line buffer of the vertical sampling block in case the video picture is processed by the vertical filtering unit.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up-/down-sampling of video window #n (#I for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity) Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Vertical initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).
Horizontal initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up-/down-sampling of video window #n (#I for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity) Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Vertical initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).
Horizontal initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: RCr Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
RY Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: GY Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
RCb Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023)

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: GCb Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
GCr Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: BCr coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
BY coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: BCb Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for video window #n(#j for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity: 0 for even field and 1 for odd field). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary)

register.description: The register configures the base address of the video buffer for video window #n(#j for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity: 0 for even field and 1 for odd field). Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video base address Base address of the video buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary)

register.description: The register configures the position of video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Y position of video window #n Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the Y position of video window #n. [[br]]The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
X position of video window #n Encoded value (from 0 to 2047) to specify the X position of video window #n. [[br]]The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the size of video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of lines of video #n Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines of video window #n (program to value minus one).
Number of pixels of video window #n Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of video window #n (program to value minus one).
The field configures the DISPC VID2 to process incoming data as pre-multiplied alpha data or non pre-multiplied alpha data. [[br]]Default setting is non pre-multiplied alpha data.
Enables the self refresh of the video window from its own FIFO only.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline does not need anymore to fetch data from memory. Only the video FIFO is used. It takes effect after the frame has been loaded in the FIFO
The video pipeline accesses the interconnect to fetch data from the system memory

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the video pipeline. [[br]]The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. [[br]]The arbitration wheel gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. [[br]]When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The video pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline
The video pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline

bitfield.description: Video vertical line buffer split

bitenum.description: Vertical line buffers are split into two
Vertical line buffers are not split

bitfield.description: Video vertical resize tap number

bitenum.description: Five taps are used for the vertical filtering logic
Three taps are used for the vertical filtering logic. The other two taps are not used

bitfield.description: Video optimization in case of

bitenum.description: The DMA engine fetches two pixels for each 32-bit OCP request (RGB16 and YUV422) while doing 90- and 270-degree rotation (accessing on-chip memory and off-chip memory). The bit field [21] VIDVERTICALTAPS shall be set to 0x1, bit field [22] VIDLINEBUFFERSPLIT to 0x1, and all scaler registers shall be configured even for 1:1 ratio. Even width is required for the input picture when 5 taps are used.
The DMA engine fetches one pixel for each 32-bit OCP request (RGB16 and YUV422) while doing 90- and 270-degree rotation (accessing on-chip memory and off-chip memory).

bitfield.description: Video preload value

bitenum.description: H/W prefetches pixels up to the high threshold value.
H/W prefetches pixels up to the preload value defined in the preload register

bitfield.description: Video Row Repeat (YUV case only when rotating 90 or [[br]]270-degree)

bitenum.description: The Row data are fetched twice to extract both the Y components
Row of VIDn won't be read twice

bitfield.description: Video Endianness
Video Channel Out configuration
Video DMA Burst Size
Video Rotation Flag

bitenum.description: No rotation or VidFormat is RGB

bitfield.description: VidFullRange

bitenum.description: Full range selected: Y is not modified before the color space conversion
Limited range selected: 16 subtracted from Y before color space conversion

bitfield.description: VidReplicationEnable
VidColorConvEnable

bitenum.description: Enable Color Space Conversion CbYCr to RGB
Disable Color Space Conversion CbYCr to RGB

bitfield.description: Video Vertical Resize Configuration
Video Horizontal Resize Configuration
Video Resize Enable

bitenum.description: Enable both horizontal and vertical resize processing

bitfield.description: Video2 channel Format[[br]] Other enums: Reserved (all other values: 0x0 and 0x3, 0x7, and 0xF)

bitenum.description: RGBx 32 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)

bitfield.description: VidEnable

bitenum.description: Video enabled (video pipeline active and window present on the screen)
Video disabled (video pipeline inactive and window not present)

register.description: The register configures the video FIFO associated with video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video FIFO high threshold Number of bytes defining the threshold value
Video FIFO low threshold Number of bytes defining the threshold value

register.description: The register defines the video FIFO size for video pipeline #n.

bitfield.description: Video FIFO Size Number of bytes defining the FIFO value

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row for the buffer associated with video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from (-2^31)-1 to 2^31) to specify the number of bytes to increment at the end of the row in the video buffer. [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]The value 1 means next pixel. [[br]]The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. [[br]]The value 1- (n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels.

register.description: The register configures the number of bytes to increment between two pixels for the buffer associated with video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Number of bytes to increment at the end of the row Encoded signed value (from (-2^15)-1 to 2^15) to specify the number of bytes between two pixels in the video buffer. [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]The value 1 means next pixel. [[br]]The value 1+n*BPP means increment of n pixels. [[br]]The value [[br]]1-(n+1)*BPP means decrement of n pixels

register.description: The register configures the resize factors for horizontal and vertical up-/down-sampling of video window #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: Vertical increment of the up-/down-sampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]Values greater than 4096 are invalid.
Horizontal increment of the up-/down-sampling filter Encoded value (from 1 to 4096). [[br]]The value 0 is invalid. [[br]]Values greater than 4096 are invalid.

register.description: The register configures the size of the video picture associated with video layer #nbefore up-/down-scaling. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of lines of the video picture in memory (program to value minus one)

Number of pixels of the video picture Encoded value (from 1 to 2048) to specify the number of pixels of the video picture in memory (program to value minus one). [[br]]The size is limited to the size of the line buffer of the vertical sampling block in case the video picture is processed by the vertical filtering unit.

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up-/down-sampling of video window #n (#I for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity) Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Vertical initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).
Horizontal initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the resize accumulator init values for horizontal and vertical up-/down-sampling of video window #n (#I for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity) Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Vertical initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).
Horizontal initialization accu value. [[br]]Encoded value (from 0 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: RCr Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
RY Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: GY Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
RCb Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023)

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: GCb Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
GCr Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC

bitfield.description: BCr coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).
BY coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: The register configures the color space conversion matrix coefficients for video pipeline #n. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: BCb Coefficient Encoded signed value (from -1024 to 1023).

register.description: This bank of registers configures the down/up/down-scaling coefficients for the vertical resize of the video picture associated with video window #n for phases 0 to 7. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Signed coefficient C22 for vertical up/down-scaling with phase n
Signed coefficient C00 for vertical up/down-scaling with phase n

register.description: This bank of registers configures the down/up/down-scaling coefficients for the vertical resize of the video picture associated with video window #n for phases 0 to 7. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Signed coefficient C22 for vertical up/down-scaling with phase n
Signed coefficient C00 for vertical up/down-scaling with phase n

register.description: This register configures the color phase rotation matrix coefficients for the red component. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period.

bitfield.description: RR coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
RG coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
RB coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)

register.description: This register configures the color phase rotation matrix coefficients for the green component. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period

bitfield.description: GR coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
GG coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
GB coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)

BG coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)
BB coefficient Encoded signed value (from -512 to 511)

register.description: This register configures the graphics FIFO. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Graphics preload value: Number of bytes defining the preload value. [[br]]Constraint: Maximum value is (FIFO size - DMA burst size - 8) bytes

register.description: This register configures the video FIFO. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video preload value: Number of bytes defining the preload value. [[br]]Constraint: Maximum value is (FIFO size - DMA burst size - 8) bytes

register.description: This register configures the video FIFO. Shadow register, updated on VFP start period or EVSYNC.

bitfield.description: Video preload value: Number of bytes defining the preload value. [[br]]Constraint: Maximum value is (FIFO size - DMA burst size - 8) bytes
